output:
Vegan Endurance Cyclist Meal Plan

Calorie Target: ~2,800-3,000 calories

- Carbohydrates: 55-60%

  * 1 banana

  * 2 tbsp chia seeds
  * 2 tbsp hemp protein powder
  * 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
  * 1/4 cup rolled oats
- 1/4 cup raw almonds

- Coconut water

Post-Training Recovery (400 calories):

- Roasted vegetables
- Tahini dressing

Lunch (600-700 calories):
- Large mixed green salad
- Roasted chickpeas
- Avocado
- Pumpkin seeds

- Olive oil and lemon dressing

Afternoon Snack (300 calories):
- Apple
- Homemade energy balls (dates, nuts, cacao)

Dinner (700-800 calories):
- Brown rice
- Black beans
- Roasted vegetables
- Nutritional yeast
- Turmeric and ginger sauce

Evening Hydration/Recovery:

- Herbal tea

Nutritional Focus:
- High complex carbohydrates
- Plant-based proteins
- Anti-inflammatory foods
- Whole food sources
- Sustained energy release

output:
Here's a one-day meal plan for an athlete with the specified requirements:

Nutritional Approach:
- Estimated daily calorie needs: ~2,700-3,000 calories
- High protein for muscle maintenance
- Balanced macronutrients
- Dairy-free and budget-friendly options

Meal Plan:

Breakfast (600-700 calories):
- Oatmeal with plant-based protein powder
- 1 banana
- 2 tbsp almond butter
- Cinnamon
- Water or black coffee
(Protein: 30g, Carbs: 60g, Healthy fats: 15g)

Mid-Morning Snack (250 calories):
- Apple
- 1/4 cup roasted almonds
(Protein: 8g, Carbs: 25g, Healthy fats: 12g)

Lunch (700-800 calories):
- Chicken breast (6 oz)
- Brown rice (1 cup)
- Roasted mixed vegetables
- Olive oil dressing
(Protein: 40g, Carbs: 50g, Healthy fats: 15g)

Post-Workout Shake (300 calories):
- Plant-based protein powder
- Banana
- Water
(Protein: 25g, Carbs: 30g)

Dinner (700-800 calories):
- Lean ground turkey (6 oz)
- Sweet potato
- Steamed broccoli
- Black beans
(Protein: 40g, Carbs: 60g, Healthy fats: 10g)

Evening Snack (200-250 calories):
- Hard-boiled eggs (2)
- Carrot sticks
(Protein: 12g, Carbs: 10g, Healthy fats: 10g)

Total Daily Nutrition:
- Calories: ~2,850
- Protein: ~155g
- Carbohydrates: ~225g
- Healthy Fats: ~62g

Budget-Friendly Tips:
- Buy in bulk
- Choose frozen vegetables
- Look for sales on protein sources
- Use cheaper protein alternatives like eggs and beans

Notes:
- Adjust portions based on specific training intensity
- Consult a nutritionist for personalized advice
- Rotate protein sources to maintain variety and reduce costs

  - Protein: 20-25%
  - Fats: 20-25%

Meal Plan:

🌅 Breakfast (Pre-Morning Training):
- Quinoa porridge with almond milk
- Mixed berries
- Chia seeds
- Almond butter
- Banana
Calories: ~600
Macros: High carb, moderate protein

🏊‍♂️ Post-Morning Training Recovery:
- Protein smoothie
  - Gluten-free protein powder
  - Coconut water
  - Spinach
  - Mango
  - Hemp seeds
Calories: ~350
Macros: High protein, moderate carb

🥗 Lunch:
- Grilled chicken breast
- Sweet potato
- Roasted mixed vegetables
- Olive oil dressing
- Avocado
Calories: ~700
Macros: Balanced protein, complex carbs, healthy fats

🍎 Afternoon Snack:
- Rice cakes
- Salmon jerky
- Mixed nuts
- Apple
Calories: ~400
Macros: Protein, complex carbs

🚴‍♂️ Pre-Evening Training:
- Brown rice
- Lean turkey
- Steamed broccoli
Calories: ~450
Macros: Complex carbs, lean protein

🏃‍♂️ Post-Evening Training Recovery:
- Salmon
- Quinoa
- Roasted asparagus
- Coconut aminos
Calories: ~600
Macros: Lean protein, complex carbs

🌙 Evening Snack:
- Gluten-free granola
- Almond milk
- Pumpkin seeds
Calories: ~300
Macros: Complex carbs, healthy fats

- Electrolyte drinks during/after training

- Gluten-free multivitamin
- Omega-3 supplement
- Electrolyte replacement

Key Nutritional Strategies:
- Gluten-free whole grains
- Lactose-free protein sources
- High nutrient density
- Balanced macronutrients
- Supports high-intensity training

Customization Recommendations:
- Adjust portion sizes based on specific training intensity
- Monitor energy levels and performance
- Consult sports nutritionist for personalized plan

Notes:
- All meals are gluten-free
- No dairy products used
- Focuses on whole, nutrient-dense foods
- Supports triathlon training demands

Disclaimer: Individual nutritional needs vary. Consult a professional sports nutritionist for personalized advice.
